boat.full_description: Built in Norway of a. true Colin Archer type as a half decked ship's boat. It is believed she was bought to England on the deck of a steamer. She had two owners in England until 1953 when she was bought by Mr. Young’s father. She was then gunter rigged with a very small sail plan which Mr Young replaced and later added a lead keel in place of the internal ballast. She finished second in the East Coast Old Gaffers Race and was Class 3 winner of 1965. In 1968 a cabin top was fitted and in the 1971 race she finished first overall on corrected time the Stone Trophy.
boat.name: Four Sisters
